description: On Friday, federal authorities ordered Nicole Micheroni to leave the country within seven days.
title: Citizen who was ordered to leave the U.S. in 7 days says she's heard nothing from federal officials

description: From sharing IRS data with ICE, calling for registries and revoking the legal mechanisms thousands have used to come to the U.S., Trump's directives send a clear message.
title: Trump officials are using federal agencies to make life in the U.S. untenable for undocumented immigrants

description: Former President Joe Biden used his first public remarks since leaving office in January to rebuke the Trump administration’s approach to Social Security.
title: Biden goes after Trump on Social Security in his first public post-presidency speech

description: Multiple New York prison guards have been indicted in connection with the “disturbing” death of an inmate last month during a wildcat officers’ strike, Gov.
title: New York prison guards indicted in connection with inmate's death, governor says

description: In a heartwarming show of community spirit, the small town of Chelsea, Michigan, pulled off a literary feat worthy of its own novel.
title: A Michigan community takes a novel approach to moving 9,100 books for shop's next chapter

description: Two Mississippi Capitol Police officers have been charged with manslaughter in the fatal shooting of a young father during a 2022 traffic stop.
title: Mississippi officers charged in young father's shooting death

description: As the two largest economies in the world — the United States and China — continue to spar over tariffs, the escalating trade war is spurring some Americans to favor Chinese goods in ways they never did before.
title: Chinese warehouses are persuading Americans to buy China-made dupes to offset tariff costs

description: President Donald Trump is facing renewed pressure from the courts, Democrats and members of the public over the U.S. government mistakenly deporting a Maryland man to a prison in El Salvador.
title: Trump's deportation agenda takes center stage: From the Politics Desk

description: Harvard University’s defiance of the Trump administration Monday brought repercussions for the institution — but widespread support on campus and beyond.
title: Harvard students and faculty celebrate defiance of Trump's demands

description: After the Trump administration announced a $2.2 billion freeze on grants to Harvard, some critics have questioned why it can’t just make up for federal funding with endowments.
title: Why colleges like Harvard can't use endowments to replace federal funding

description: U.S. researchers will soon test whether livers from a gene-edited pig could treat people with sudden liver failure — by temporarily filtering their blood so their own organ can rest and maybe heal.
title: FDA OKs trial of pig livers as dialysis-like treatment for liver failure

description: Judge Paula Xinis ordered the administration to provide evidence about what steps it's taken — or hasn't taken — to facilitate the return of Kilmar Abrego Garcia.
title: Judge in deportation case indicates she's weighing contempt proceedings against Trump admin

description: United Airlines is planning to cut flights starting this summer to match disappointing domestic travel demand while bookings for pricier, international trips remain strong.
title: United to cut flights as domestic demand disappoints but international and premium travel drives profits

description: The Trump administration has cited antisemitism as a key reason it has targeted universities and activists. While some Jewish groups have cheered these moves, others have fiercely criticized them.
title: Some Jewish Americans wrestle with Trump's sweeping crusade against antisemitism

description: A federal cybersecurity specialist has alleged in a whistleblower statement made public Tuesday that President Donald Trump’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) caused a security breach at the National Labor Relations Board and may have illegally removed sensitive data from the board.
title: Federal employee alleges DOGE activity resulted in data breach at labor board

description: Undocumented immigrants do not qualify for Social Security benefits, but lawful permanent residents are if they meet certain criteria.
title: Trump to sign memo aimed at preventing undocumented immigrants from obtaining Social Security benefits

description: U.S. stocks posted modest losses on Tuesday, as investors analyzed the latest batch of first-quarter earnings reports and enjoyed a recent decline in market turmoil.
title: S&P 500 falls marginally Tuesday as tariff volatility subsides

description: Jennifer, the wife of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man mistakenly deported to El Salvador by the Trump administration, spoke out about Garcia's departure. Speaking through tears, she accused the U.S. and Salvadoran governments of playing politics with his life. She said, "Enough is enough," calling for his release and vowing not to stop fighting until he's home.
title: 'Enough is enough': Wife of mistakenly deported Kilmar Garcia demands his return

description: The search is on for a team of thieves who stole millions of dollars in merchandise and cash after they tunneled into a downtown Los Angeles jewelry store.
title: Thieves tunnel into L.A. jewelry store and steal $20 million in merchandise, owners say

description: Investors may feel an impulse to move to cash amid the recent tumult in the stock market.
title: Cash may feel safe when stocks slide, but it has risks

description: A new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found a dramatic rise in Autism diagnoses among children. NBC News’ Erika Edwards details the findings of the report.
title: Autism rates rise to 1 in 31 school-age children, CDC says

description: A Connecticut man who officials say was held captive by his stepmom for more than two decades is speaking out publicly for the first time since the fire that led to his freedom.
title: Being held captive for 20 years 'isn't just a story. It's my life,' Connecticut man says

description: Harvey Weinstein had a big smile on his face Tuesday when he showed up in a New York City court for the retrial of his landmark sexual assault case that defined the #MeToo movement, but the foreman of the jury that convicted him in 2020 said the disgraced Hollywood producer may not be grinning when this trial is over.
title: Foreman from Harvey Weinstein's first N.Y. trial stands by his verdict

description: Epic things are coming to Orlando.
title: Universal's new Epic Universe park set to generate $2 billion for Florida in year one

description: Amazon is reaching out to third-party merchants, who account for the majority of products the company sells, to gauge how President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs are affecting their businesses.
title: Amazon emails sellers to gauge how Trump's tariffs are impacting their businesses

description: President Trump participates in a commander-in-chief trophy presentation ceremony at the White House for the 2024 Navy Midshipmen.
title: Trump honors Navy football team at trophy ceremony

description: A sports reporter is being called out by fellow journalists over an inappropriate moment during the Atlanta Braves broadcast Monday night when he asked for female fans' phone numbers on air.
title: Atlanta Braves broadcast slammed for 'gross' moment when reporter asks women for numbers

description: A funeral will be held Tuesday afternoon for a 17-year-old Idaho boy with autism who was shot and killed by police earlier this month.
title: Funeral to be held for Idaho teen with autism shot 9 times by police in his yard

description: Watch live coverage of former President Joe Biden making his first public speech since leaving office. Biden’s remarks will focus on protecting social security.
title: Biden gives first speech since leaving office

description: An angry Indiana mother is facing multiple charges after allegedly bringing a gun to her daughter's elementary school and threatening the sixth grader's lesbian teacher to "kiss ur kids goodbye" after she gave an assignment about flags, officials said Tuesday.
title: Mom arrested for bringing gun to school for confrontation with lesbian teacher

description: Hertz is notifying customers that a data hack late last year may have exposed their personal data.
title: Hertz says 2024 hack exposed some customers' driver license and credit card data

description: One in 31 children in the U.S. is diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder by their eighth birthday, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Tuesday.
title: Autism rates have risen to 1 in 31 school-age children, CDC reports

description: Rep. Ro Khanna, D-Calif., unleashed an early 2028 attack on Vice President JD Vance at Yale on Tuesday, attempting to frame him as a threat to the Constitution.
title: Rep. Ro Khanna compares Vance to Stalin as he stakes out space in Democrats' 2028 field

description: Looks like what happens in Thailand doesn’t always stay in Thailand.
title: Jason Isaacs shuts down speculation about the 'The White Lotus' Season 3 cast

description: Are you team cake or team frosting?
title: All icing and no cake: People are eating frosting straight from the jar on TikTok

description: Ben Affleck and Jon Bernthal shared a way to see their new movie “The Accountant 2” a little bit early in honor of Tax Day.
title: 'Accountant 2' stars Ben Affleck and Jon Bernthal share how to see their movie early

description: Nick Carter is opening up about the death of younger brother Aaron Carter and sharing why he still hasn’t “had a chance to grieve.”
title: Nick Carter shares how he found out Aaron had died: 'I haven't had a chance to grieve'

description: China has for the first time publicly accused three hackers of working for the National Security Agency and offered a reward for information leading to their arrest, echoing tactics the U.S. routinely uses against alleged Chinese cyberspies.
title: China escalates cyber fight with U.S., names alleged NSA hackers

description: Rapper Sean Kingston, who along with his mother was found guilty of federal wire fraud last month, was held in a federal prison for several days after he was initially unable to complete a $100,000 bond, according to court records.
title: Sean Kingston held in federal prison after he was unable to provide $100K bond

description: Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, opened up about suffering a miscarriage in 2020 on the new episode of her podcast.
title: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, opens up about 2020 miscarriage

description: The medical examiner who performed an autopsy on Charles Vallow, the fourth husband of “doomsday mom” Lori Vallow Daybell, testified Monday that he could have been lying on a floor when he was shot — after a bullet had already gone through his heart.
title: Medical examiner testifies about bullet wounds in Lori Vallow's trial

description: American singer and rapper Lil Nas X said that one side of his face has become paralyzed as fans and commenters worried he might have Bell's palsy.
title: Lil Nas X says one side of his face is paralyzed

description: As China imposes export controls on rare earth elements, the U.S. would be unable to fill a potential shortfall, according to the Center for Strategic and International Studies, a Washington-based think tank — and this could threaten Washington’s military capabilities.
title: China's export controls on rare earth elements could threaten U.S. defense, group warns

description: A group of universities — including Brown University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology — and education groups filed a lawsuit on Tuesday seeking to halt the Department of Energy's cuts to federal research grants.
title: Universities sue over Energy Department research funding cuts

description: A man is facing a federal charge after allegedly threatening to kill Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard and her husband, the Department of Justice announced on Monday.
title: Man arrested after threatening Tulsi Gabbard and her husband

description: Bryce Harper is set to take another swing at fatherhood — and he did it with a blue bat.
title: Phillies star Bryce Harper uses a blue bat in gender reveal for his child

description: Democratic lawmakers led by Sen. Chris Van Hollen say they are willing to go to El Salvador to seek the release of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who the Justice Department says it mistakenly deported there.
title: Democratic lawmakers say they'll travel to El Salvador to push for Kilmar Abrego Garcia's release

description: A U.S. district judge will hold a hearing this afternoon on the status of efforts by the Trump administration to bring a Maryland man it said it mistakenly deported to El Salvador back to the United States.
title: Trump admin to give update on status of mistakenly deported man

description: New details are emerging on Cody Balmer, the man charged with suspected homicide, arson and terrorism after allegedly starting a fire at Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro's residence. Court documents allege Balmer told police he was "harboring hatred" toward the governor. NBC’s Shaquille Brewster reports for TODAY.
title: New details emerge on man suspected of torching PA gov. mansion

description: During an Oval Office meeting with President Donald Trump, El Salvador’s President Nayib Bukele says he’s not going to return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was on a work permit in Maryland, back to the United States. In the same meeting, Trump floats deporting U.S. citizens, who he describes as “home grown criminals,” to foreign prisons. “I'd like to include them in the group of people to get them out of the country, but you'll have to be looking at the laws on that,” Trump says. NBC’s
title: Trump mulls imprisoning US citizens abroad: 'Homegrowns are next'

description: President Donald Trump came into office promising the largest mass deportation in U.S history, targeting the more than 10 million unauthorized migrants living in the United States.
title: U.S. deportation tracker: Counting arrests, detentions and border crossings

description: Fast-food chains are refreshing their locations and adding new tech, hoping to keep diners ordering at a time when many are cutting back on meals away from home.
title: Minimalism with a side of fries: Restaurants are on a remodeling spree

description: Figures obtained by NBC News show deportations in March below where they were a year ago, and far below what the administration wants
title: Trump admin pushing immigrants to self-deport as its deportation numbers lag

description: The former Columbia University student arrested on campus and slated for deportation has filed evidence that shows claims underlying the government's case are dubious.
title: Government's case against Mahmoud Khalil shaky and reliant on tabloid accounts, review of evidence shows

description: The New York helicopter tour company that operated the sightseeing tour that crashed into the Hudson River last week, killing all six aboard, has been grounded by the Federal Aviation Administration, the agency said Monday.
title: Helicopter tour company flights grounded after deadly crash in Hudson River

description: A Republican proposal in the Florida state House would bar state employees from conducting most traditional campaign-type activities during working hours.
title: Florida GOP tries to crack down after Ron DeSantis' state staff helped raise political cash

description: A former Colorado sheriff’s deputy convicted of killing Christian Glass, a 22-year-old man in distress who called 911 for help, was sentenced Monday to three years in prison.
title: Ex-Colorado deputy gets 3 years in prison for fatally shooting man who called for help
